name: Purple Yam Jam
author: Jasmin Monteclar
summary: This is a Filipino recipe. It's called halayang ube in the Philippines. It's a sweet treat made from purple yam which is commonly found in the country. You can eat this with bread or by itself.
ingredients: ½ (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk
directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil
Cook yam in the boiling water until tender, about 30 minutes
Drain and cool until easily handled
Peel and thinly grate the flesh
Melt butter in a wok over medium heat
Stir in condensed milk and vanilla extract
Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture is sticky but not dry, about 30 minutes
Pour in evaporated milk; cook and stir for 15 minutes
Transfer yam mixture to a container and cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes
